item.title: 迪斯尼就女性薪酬诉讼案达成 4300 万美元和解
item.description: 原告律师周一在一份声明中表示，华特迪士尼已同意支付 4,330 万美元，以了结一项指控其加利福尼亚州女员工在八年时间里比男员工少挣 1.5 亿美元的诉讼。【原文：Walt Disney has agreed to pay $43.3 million to settle a lawsuit alleging that its female employees in California earned $150 million less than their male counterparts over an eight-year period, the plaintiffs' lawyers said in a statement on Monday.】

item.title: 在保守派的压力下，沃尔玛将撤销部分多元化政策
item.description: 沃尔玛的一位发言人周一表示，沃尔玛计划削减部分多元化、公平和包容性（DEI）举措，加入了越来越多感受到保守团体压力的企业行列。【原文：Walmart plans to cut back some of its diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) initiatives, a spokesperson for the retailer said on Monday, joining a growing list of firms feeling the heat from conservative groups.】

item.title: 罗氏将收购美国 Poseida Therapeutics 公司
item.description: 瑞士罗氏公司周二表示，将以每股 9 美元的价格收购总部位于加利福尼亚州的生物制药公司 Poseida Therapeutics，收购完成后的股权总价值将达到 10 亿美元。【原文：Roche will acquire California-based biopharmafirm Poseida Therapeutics for $9 per share at closing, for a total equity value of $1 billion, the Swiss company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 谷歌提议重新调整欧洲搜索结果
item.description: 在一些较小的竞争对手抱怨 Alphabet 旗下公司之前的调整导致其网站流量下降，以及欧盟反垄断监管机构考虑根据新的欧盟技术规则对该公司提出指控之后，谷歌提出对其在欧洲的搜索结果进行更多调整。【原文：Google has proposed more changes to its search results in Europe after some smaller rivals complained about lower traffic to their sites resulting from previous tweaks by the Alphabet unit and as EU antitrust regulators consider levying charges against the company under new EU tech rules.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，日产寻求投资者以取代雷诺持有的部分股权
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周二报道，日产汽车公司正在寻找长期投资者，如银行或保险集团，以帮助其取代雷诺被稀释的部分股权。【原文：Nissan Motor is looking for a long-term investor, such as a bank or insurance group, to help it replace some of Renault's diluted stakeholding, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，花旗集团在寻求全面改革银行时削减了晋升职位
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周二报道，花旗集团正在减少年终晋升的人数，因为该公司正在进行长期重组，以缩减员工人数，从而降低成本。【原文：Citigroup is cutting the number of year-end promotions it awards as it seeks to hold costs down amid a long-term restructuring to shrink headcount, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 早间竞价特朗普加征关税引发市场恐慌
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: 阿达尼绿色能源公司称未与道达尔能源公司讨论新的财务承诺
item.description: 阿达尼绿色能源公司（Adani Green Energy）周二表示，目前尚未与道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）商讨新的财务承诺，而在此前一天，这家法国石油巨头还表示将暂停对阿达尼集团的新投资。【原文：Adani Green Energy said on Tuesday there is no new financial commitment under discussion with TotalEnergies , a day after the French oil major said it was pausing new investments into the Adani Group.】

item.title: Rivian 获得 66 亿美元有条件贷款，以在佐治亚州建设电动汽车工厂
item.description: Rivian 周一表示，该公司已获得美国能源部有条件批准的高达 66 亿美元的贷款，用于在佐治亚州建设这家电动汽车制造商的生产设施。【原文：Rivian said on Monday it has received conditional approval for a loan of up to $6.6 billion from the U.S. Department of Energy to build the electric vehicle maker's production facility in Georgia.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税承诺给汽车和科技公司带来麻烦
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普周一承诺对美国的三大贸易伙伴--加拿大、墨西哥和中国--征收关税，详细说明了他将如何履行可能引发贸易战的竞选承诺。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump on Monday pledged tariffs on the United States' three largest trading partners - Canada, Mexico and China - detailing how he will implement campaign promises that could trigger trade wars.】

item.title: 谷歌、Meta 敦促澳大利亚推迟儿童社交媒体禁令法案
item.description: 谷歌和 Facebook 的所有者 Meta Platforms 周二敦促澳大利亚政府推迟一项法案，该法案将禁止 16 岁以下儿童使用大多数形式的社交媒体，并称需要更多时间来评估其潜在影响。【原文：Google and Facebook-owner Meta Platforms urged the Australian government on Tuesday to delay a bill that will ban most forms of social media for children under 16, saying more time was needed to assess its potential impact.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，高通对收购英特尔的兴趣有所降温
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一援引知情人士的话报道，高通公司收购芯片制造商英特尔的兴趣据说已经降温。【原文：Qualcomm's interest in acquiring chipmaker Intel is said to have cooled, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普发出关税威胁后，中国表示 "没有人会赢得贸易战
item.description: 在美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁要在1月20日上任后对所有中国进口商品征收10%的额外关税后，中国驻华盛顿大使馆周一表示，美国和中国都不会在贸易战中获胜。【原文：Neither the United States nor China would win a trade war, the Chinese Embassy in Washington said on Monday, after U.S. President-elect Donald Trump threatened to slap an additional 10% tariff on all Chinese imports when he takes office on Jan. 20.】

item.title: 结束以色列-真主党冲突的潜在协议导致石油下跌
item.description: 周二早盘，油价下滑，延续了上一交易日的跌势，原因是投资者对以色列与真主党之间可能达成的停火进行了评估，从而对石油的风险溢价造成了压力。【原文：Oil prices slipped in early trade on Tuesday, extending declines from the previous session as investors took stock of a potential ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah, weighing on oil's risk premium.】

item.title: 美国贿赂指控后，惠誉将部分阿达尼债券列入负面观察名单
item.description: 在阿达尼集团（Adani Group）的一些主要高管因贿赂指控被美国当局起诉后，评级机构惠誉（Fitch）已将该公司的部分债券评级列入可能下调的观察名单。【原文：Ratings agency Fitch has put some of Adani Group's bonds on watch for a possible downgrade after some of the firm's key executives were indicted by U.S. authorities on bribery charges.】

item.title: 特朗普誓言对墨西哥和加拿大征收关税后美元上涨
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，他将签署一项行政命令，对所有从墨西哥和加拿大进入美国的产品征收25%的关税，此后美元兑主要对手货币周二普遍上涨。【原文：The U.S. dollar rose broadly against major rivals on Tuesday after President-elect Donald Trump said he would sign an executive order imposing a 25% tariff on all products coming in to the United States from Mexico and Canada.】

item.title: 巴西反垄断机构裁定苹果必须取消应用内支付限制
item.description: 巴西反垄断监管机构 Cade 周一表示，苹果公司必须取消对应用内购买支付方式等的限制，该监管机构将着手调查拉丁美洲电子商务巨头 MercadoLibre 提起的投诉。【原文：Brazilian antitrust regulator Cade said on Monday that Apple must lift restrictions on payment methods for in-app purchases, among other things, as the watchdog moved to proceed with an investigation into a complaint filed by Latin America e-commerce giant MercadoLibre.】

item.title: 市场对特朗普关税誓言的反应
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普周一表示，在他上任的第一天，他将对来自墨西哥和加拿大的所有产品征收 25% 的关税，并对来自中国的商品额外征收 10% 的关税。【原文：U.S. President-elect Donald Trump said on Monday that on his first day in office he would impose a 25% tariff on all products from Mexico and Canada, and an additional 10% tariff on goods from China.】

item.title: 特朗普发出关税警告，美元反弹；股市走低
item.description: 在美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁加拿大和墨西哥将对所有进口到美国的商品征收 25% 的关税后，美元兑主要货币汇率周二上涨。【原文：The dollar rose against major peers on Tuesday after U.S. President-elect Donald Trump threatened Canada and Mexico with a 25% tariff on all imports into the United States.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利：12 月降息 "合理
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）周一表示，他对下月再次降息持开放态度。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari, typically on the hawkish end of the U.S. central bank's policy spectrum, said on Monday he is open to cutting interest rates again next month.】

item.title: 特朗普承诺对加拿大和墨西哥征收 25% 的关税，对中国征收更高的关税
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普周一表示，他将在上任第一天对来自墨西哥和加拿大的所有产品征收 25% 的关税，并对来自中国的商品额外征收 10% 的关税，理由是对非法移民和非法毒品贸易的担忧。【原文：U.S. President-elect Donald Trump said on Monday that on his first day in office he would impose a 25% tariff on all products from Mexico and Canada, and an additional 10% tariff on goods from China, citing concerns over illegal immigration and the trade of illicit drugs.】

item.title: 随着 1 月 19 日撤资截止日期的临近，TikTok 即将做出决定
item.description: 美国联邦上诉法院预计将在 12 月 6 日前裁定是否支持要求中国字节跳动公司在明年初之前剥离其在美国的流行短视频应用 TikTok，否则将面临禁令的法律。【原文：A U.S. federal appeals court is expected to rule by Dec. 6 whether to uphold a law requiring Chinese-based ByteDance to divest its popular short video app TikTok in the U.S. by early next year or face a ban.】

item.title: 美国指控前 Wamco 联席首席信息官肯尼思-利奇欺诈
item.description: 西部资产管理公司（Western Asset Management Co）前联席首席投资官肯尼思-利奇（Kenneth Leech）周一被美国当局指控实施了一项欺诈性的 "樱桃挑选 "计划，即在分配交易时不适当地偏向一些客户的账户而不是其他客户的账户。【原文：Kenneth Leech, the former co-chief investment officer of Western Asset Management Co, was charged by U.S. authorities on Monday with running a fraudulent "cherry-picking" scheme where he improperly favored some clients' accounts over others when allocating trades.】

item.title: 亚洲 特朗普财政部长人选提振债券市场，美元走软
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 科尔百货公司首席执行官在掌舵不到两年后卸任
item.description: 科尔百货公司（Kohl's）周一表示，汤姆-金斯伯里（Tom Kingsbury）计划在担任近两年的首席执行官后卸任，这使得该连锁百货公司的股价在盘后交易中下跌了约 5%。【原文：Kohl's said on Monday that Tom Kingsbury plans to step down after a nearly two-year stint as CEO, sending the department store chain's shares down about 5% in extended trading.】

item.title: 美国拒绝重新考虑汽车自动紧急制动新规则的请求
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周一表示，不会重新考虑今年 4 月敲定的一项具有里程碑意义的规定，即要求到 2029 年，几乎所有的新车和卡车都必须配备先进的自动紧急制动系统。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Monday it will not reconsider a landmark rule finalized in April requiring nearly all new cars and trucks by 2029 to have advanced automatic emergency braking systems.】

item.title: Zoom 上调年度收入预期
item.description: 本周一，Zoom Video Communications 上调了 2025 财年的收入预期，预计随着其产品组合的扩大和客户对混合工作模式的接受，在线视频会议软件的需求将十分强劲。【原文：Zoom Video Communications raised its forecast for fiscal 2025 revenue on Monday, anticipating robust demand for its online video conferencing software as it expands its product portfolio, and clients embrace hybrid working models.】

item.title: 软件供应商遭勒索软件攻击，星巴克面临业务中断
item.description: 星巴克发言人周一表示，软件供应商遭受勒索软件攻击的后果影响了星巴克向咖啡师支付工资和管理他们日程安排的能力。【原文：Starbucks said the aftermath of a ransomware attack on a software supplier has been affecting its ability to pay baristas and manage their schedules, the company's spokesperson said on Monday.】

item.title: 在美国联邦贸易委员会寻求解除 Instagram 合并案中，Meta 将于四月出庭受审
item.description: 华盛顿的一名法官周一表示，Facebook 的所有者 Meta Platforms 将于四月就美国联邦贸易委员会指控该社交媒体平台收购 Instagram 和 WhatsApp 以打压新兴竞争者一事出庭受审。【原文：Facebook owner Meta Platforms will face trial in April over the U.S. Federal Trade Commission's allegations that the social media platform bought Instagram and WhatsApp to crush emerging competition, a judge in Washington said on Monday.】

item.title: 联合信贷银行首席执行官对政府对 BPM 银行交易的反应并不感到惊讶
item.description: 意大利联合信贷银行首席执行官 Andrea Orcel 表示，意大利政府对该行主动竞购竞争对手 Banco BPM 的初步反应是很自然的，因为银行系统的每一个变化都需要仔细评估。【原文：UniCredit CEO Andrea Orcel said the Italian government's initial response to his bank's unsolicited bid for rival Banco BPM is only natural as every change in the banking system needs careful assessment.】
